trans-unit.source: You can store and access non-essential data on an optional microSD card, especially on low-cost mobile devices that have limited internal storage.
trans-unit.target: You can store and access non-essential data on an optional microSD card, especially on low-cost mobile devices that have limited internal storage.

trans-unit.source: In most cases, you have to specify the **removableStorage** capability in the app manifest file before your app can store and access files on the SD card.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, you have to specify the **removableStorage** capability in the app manifest file before your app can store and access files on the SD card.

trans-unit.source: Typically you also have to register to handle the type of files that your app stores and accesses.
trans-unit.target: Typically you also have to register to handle the type of files that your app stores and accesses.

trans-unit.source: You can store and access files on the optional SD card by using the following methods:
trans-unit.target: You can store and access files on the optional SD card by using the following methods:

trans-unit.source: File pickers.
trans-unit.target: File pickers.

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Storage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227346) APIs.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Storage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227346) APIs.

trans-unit.source: What you can and can't access on the SD card
trans-unit.target: What you can and can't access on the SD card

trans-unit.source: What you can access
trans-unit.target: What you can access

trans-unit.source: Your app can only read and write files of file types that the app has registered to handle in the app manifest file.
trans-unit.target: Your app can only read and write files of file types that the app has registered to handle in the app manifest file.

trans-unit.source: Your app can also create and manage folders.
trans-unit.target: Your app can also create and manage folders.

trans-unit.source: What you can't access
trans-unit.target: What you can't access

trans-unit.source: Your app can't see or access system folders and the files that they contain.
trans-unit.target: Your app can't see or access system folders and the files that they contain.

trans-unit.source: Your app can't see files that are marked with the Hidden attribute.
trans-unit.target: Your app can't see files that are marked with the Hidden attribute.

trans-unit.source: The Hidden attribute is typically used to reduce the risk of deleting data accidentally.
trans-unit.target: The Hidden attribute is typically used to reduce the risk of deleting data accidentally.

trans-unit.source: Your app can't see or access the Documents library by using [**KnownFolders.DocumentsLibrary**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227152).
trans-unit.target: Your app can't see or access the Documents library by using [**KnownFolders.DocumentsLibrary**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227152).

trans-unit.source: However you can access the Documents library on the SD card by traversing the file system.
trans-unit.target: However you can access the Documents library on the SD card by traversing the file system.

trans-unit.source: Security and privacy considerations
trans-unit.target: Security and privacy considerations

trans-unit.source: When an app saves files in a global location on the SD card, those files are not encrypted so they are typically accessible to other apps.
trans-unit.target: When an app saves files in a global location on the SD card, those files are not encrypted so they are typically accessible to other apps.

trans-unit.source: While the SD card is in the device, your files are accessible to other apps that have registered to handle the same file type.
trans-unit.target: While the SD card is in the device, your files are accessible to other apps that have registered to handle the same file type.

trans-unit.source: When the SD card is removed from the device and opened from a PC, your files are visible in File Explorer and accessible to other apps.
trans-unit.target: When the SD card is removed from the device and opened from a PC, your files are visible in File Explorer and accessible to other apps.

trans-unit.source: When an app installed on the SD card saves files in its [**LocalFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241621), however, those files are encrypted and are not accessible to other apps.
trans-unit.target: When an app installed on the SD card saves files in its [**LocalFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241621), however, those files are encrypted and are not accessible to other apps.

trans-unit.source: Requirements for accessing files on the SD card
trans-unit.target: Requirements for accessing files on the SD card

trans-unit.source: To access files on the SD card, typically you have to specify the following things.
trans-unit.target: To access files on the SD card, typically you have to specify the following things.

trans-unit.source: You have to specify the **removableStorage** capability in the app manifest file.
trans-unit.target: You have to specify the **removableStorage** capability in the app manifest file.

trans-unit.source: You also have to register to handle the file extensions associated with the type of media that you want to access.
trans-unit.target: You also have to register to handle the file extensions associated with the type of media that you want to access.

trans-unit.source: Use the preceding method also to access media files on the SD card without referencing a known folder like **KnownFolders.MusicLibrary**, or to access media files that are stored outside of the media library folders.
trans-unit.target: Use the preceding method also to access media files on the SD card without referencing a known folder like **KnownFolders.MusicLibrary**, or to access media files that are stored outside of the media library folders.

trans-unit.source: To access media files stored in the media libraries—Music, Photos, or Videos—by using known folders, you only have to specify the associated capability in the app manifest file—**musicLibrary**, **picturesLibrary**, or **videoLibrary**.
trans-unit.target: To access media files stored in the media libraries—Music, Photos, or Videos—by using known folders, you only have to specify the associated capability in the app manifest file—**musicLibrary**, **picturesLibrary**, or **videoLibrary**.

trans-unit.source: You do not have to specify the **removableStorage** capability.
trans-unit.target: You do not have to specify the **removableStorage** capability.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries](quickstart-managing-folders-in-the-music-pictures-and-videos-libraries.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries](quickstart-managing-folders-in-the-music-pictures-and-videos-libraries.md).

trans-unit.source: Getting a reference to the SD card
trans-unit.target: Getting a reference to the SD card

trans-unit.source: The [**KnownFolders.RemovableDevices**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227158) folder is the logical root [**StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) for the set of removable devices currently connected to the device.
trans-unit.target: The [**KnownFolders.RemovableDevices**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227158) folder is the logical root [**StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) for the set of removable devices currently connected to the device.

trans-unit.source: If an SD card is present, the first (and only) **StorageFolder** underneath the **KnownFolders.RemovableDevices** folder represents the SD card.
trans-unit.target: If an SD card is present, the first (and only) **StorageFolder** underneath the **KnownFolders.RemovableDevices** folder represents the SD card.

trans-unit.source: Querying the contents of the SD card
trans-unit.target: Querying the contents of the SD card

trans-unit.source: The SD card can contain many folders and files that aren't recognized as known folders and can't be queried by using a location from [**KnownFolders**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227151).
trans-unit.target: The SD card can contain many folders and files that aren't recognized as known folders and can't be queried by using a location from [**KnownFolders**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227151).

trans-unit.source: To find files, your app has to enumerate the contents of the card by traversing the file system recursively.
trans-unit.target: To find files, your app has to enumerate the contents of the card by traversing the file system recursively.

trans-unit.source: Use [**GetFilesAsync (CommonFileQuery.DefaultQuery)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227274) and [**GetFoldersAsync (CommonFolderQuery.DefaultQuery)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227281) to get the contents of the SD card efficiently.
trans-unit.target: Use [**GetFilesAsync (CommonFileQuery.DefaultQuery)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227274) and [**GetFoldersAsync (CommonFolderQuery.DefaultQuery)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227281) to get the contents of the SD card efficiently.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you use a background thread to traverse the SD card.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you use a background thread to traverse the SD card.

trans-unit.source: An SD card may contain many gigabytes of data.
trans-unit.target: An SD card may contain many gigabytes of data.

trans-unit.source: Your app can also require the user to choose specific folders by using the folder picker.
trans-unit.target: Your app can also require the user to choose specific folders by using the folder picker.

trans-unit.source: When you access the file system on the SD card with a path that you derived from [**KnownFolders.RemovableDevices**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227158), the following methods behave in the following way.
trans-unit.target: When you access the file system on the SD card with a path that you derived from [**KnownFolders.RemovableDevices**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227158), the following methods behave in the following way.

trans-unit.source: The [**GetFilesAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227273) method returns the union of the file extensions that you have registered to handle and the file extensions associated with any media library capabilities that you have specified.
trans-unit.target: The [**GetFilesAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227273) method returns the union of the file extensions that you have registered to handle and the file extensions associated with any media library capabilities that you have specified.

trans-unit.source: The [**GetFileFromPathAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227206) method fails if you have not registered to handle the file extension of the file you are trying to access.
trans-unit.target: The [**GetFileFromPathAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227206) method fails if you have not registered to handle the file extension of the file you are trying to access.

trans-unit.source: Identifying the individual SD card
trans-unit.target: Identifying the individual SD card

trans-unit.source: When the SD card is first mounted, the operating system generates a unique identifier for the card.
trans-unit.target: When the SD card is first mounted, the operating system generates a unique identifier for the card.

trans-unit.source: It stores this ID in a file in the WPSystem folder at the root of the card.
trans-unit.target: It stores this ID in a file in the WPSystem folder at the root of the card.

trans-unit.source: An app can use this ID to determine whether it recognizes the card.
trans-unit.target: An app can use this ID to determine whether it recognizes the card.

trans-unit.source: If an app recognizes the card, the app may be able to postpone certain operations that were completed previously.
trans-unit.target: If an app recognizes the card, the app may be able to postpone certain operations that were completed previously.

trans-unit.source: However the contents of the card may have changed since the card was last accessed by the app.
trans-unit.target: However the contents of the card may have changed since the card was last accessed by the app.

trans-unit.source: For example, consider an app that indexes ebooks.
trans-unit.target: For example, consider an app that indexes ebooks.

trans-unit.source: If the app has previously scanned the whole SD card for ebook files and created an index of the ebooks, it can display the list immediately if the card is reinserted and the app recognizes the card.
trans-unit.target: If the app has previously scanned the whole SD card for ebook files and created an index of the ebooks, it can display the list immediately if the card is reinserted and the app recognizes the card.

trans-unit.source: Separately it can start a low-priority background thread to search for new ebooks.
trans-unit.target: Separately it can start a low-priority background thread to search for new ebooks.

trans-unit.source: It can also handle a failure to find an ebook that existed previously when the user tries to access the deleted ebook.
trans-unit.target: It can also handle a failure to find an ebook that existed previously when the user tries to access the deleted ebook.

trans-unit.source: The name of the property that contains this ID is **WindowsPhone.ExternalStorageId**.
trans-unit.target: The name of the property that contains this ID is **WindowsPhone.ExternalStorageId**.
